children.name: egg
children.definition: an egg, especially one from a chicken, that is used for food : trứng

children.name: fried/poached/boiled etc eggs
examples: Joe always hasbacon and eggfor breakfast.

children.name: a hard-boiled/soft-boiled egg
examples: How do you like your eggs - fried or boiled?

children.name: albumen
children.definition: specialized the clear part inside an egg which is white when cooked : lòng trắng trứng

children.name: egg white
children.definition: the transparent part of an eggwhich turns white when it is cooked : lòng trắng trứng
examples: Whisk four egg whites into stiff peaks.
Whisk the egg white(= the white part )until stiff.

children.name: egg yolk
children.definition: yolk/  the yellow part of an egg : lòng đỏ trứng
examples: I like eggs lightly cooked so that the yolk is still runny.
Separate the yolks from the whites.
Beat in two of the egg yolks(= the yellow part ).

children.name: buttermilk
children.definition: the liquidthat is left after taking the fat from cream to make butter : nước sữa

children.name: cheese
children.definition: a solid food made from milk, which is usually yellow or white in colour, and can be soft or hard : phó-mát; bánh phó-mát
examples: a selection of English cheeses

children.name: a piece/bit of cheese
examples: Would you like a piece of cheese?

children.name: a slice of cheese
examples: Sue cut six thin slices of cheese.

children.name: a lump/hunk of cheese
children.definition: a large piece
examples: We just had bread and a hunk of cheese for lunch.

children.name: a wedge of cheese
children.definition: a piece which is thin at one end and thick at the other
examples: I bought a half pound wedge of cheese.

children.name: bread and cheese
examples: Lunch was bread and cheese.

children.name: cheese and biscuits
examples: After the meal we had coffee with cheese and biscuits.

children.name: cheese on toast
children.definition: melted cheese on toast
examples: Would you like some cheese on toast?

children.name: strong
examples: This is one of the strongest French cheeses.

children.name: mild
children.definition: without a strong taste
examples: The cheese is mild and creamy.

children.name: hard cheese
examples: Use a hard cheese such as Cheddar for grating.

children.name: soft cheese
children.definition: that you can spread
examples: Camembert is my favourite soft cheese.

children.name: grated cheese
children.definition: that has been cut into many small pieces using a special tool
examples: Cover the vegetables with the grated cheese.

children.name: melted cheese
examples: Nachos are good with melted cheese.

children.name: cow’s/goat’s/sheep’s cheese
children.definition: from the milk of a cow etc

children.name: cream cheese
children.definition: a type of soft smooth white cheese
examples: không gạn bớt kem

children.name: cottage cheese
children.definition: a type of soft white cheese with small lumps in it
examples: làm từ sữa đã gạn kem

children.name: blue cheese
children.definition: a type of cheese with blue lines in it and a strong taste
examples: có sợi mốc xanh

children.name: processed cheese
children.definition: with substances added to preserve it

children.name: grate cheese
children.definition: cut it into many small pieces using a special tool
examples: Would you grate some cheese for me?

children.name: sprinkle cheese over/on something
children.definition: put small pieces of cheese over/on something
examples: Sprinkle the cheese over the top.

children.name: top something with cheese
children.definition: put cheese on top of something
examples: Top the potatoes with grated cheese.

children.name: a cheese sandwich
examples: I'll make you a cheese sandwich.

children.name: a cheese omelette
examples: Lunch was a cheese omelette with salad.

children.definition: a
examples: cheese sauceI made a cheese sauce to go with the pasta.

children.name: cream
children.definition: a thick yellow-white liquid that rises to the top of milk :
examples: fresh cream
strawberries and cream

children.name: single creamBritish English
children.definition: thin cream that you can pour easily

children.name: double creamBritish English,heavy creamAmerican English
children.definition: thick cream

children.name: whipping cream
children.definition: that becomes thick when you beat it

children.name: clotted creamBritish English
children.definition: very thick cream that you cannot pour
examples: kem bọc sữa

children.name: sour/soured cream
children.definition: with a slightly sour taste – used in cooking

children.name: fresh cream
examples: Use about 100ml of fresh cream.

children.name: thick cream
examples: British English Pour some thick cream over the strawberries.

children.name: whipped cream
children.definition: made thick and light by beating it

children.name: whip/whisk/beat the cream
children.definition: make it thicker by beating it
examples: Whip the cream until it is thick and light.

children.name: serve something with cream
examples: Serve the apple tart warm with thick cream.

children.name: a cream cake/bunBritish English
children.definition: a cake with cream inside

children.name: a cream teaBritish English
children.definition: tea with small cakes called scones, that you eat with cream and jam

children.name: butter
children.definition: a solid yellow food made from milk or cream that you spread on bread or use in cooking:bơ động vật
examples: cocoa butter[ U ] a substance from the cocoa bean that contains a lot of fat and is used in some foods and also in products for the skin and hair : bơ ca-cao
shea butter[ U ] a yellow fat from a type of nut, used in makeup and soap and as a food: mỡ chiết xuất từ hạt của cây hạt mỡ
This product contains avocado oil andshea butter to leave your skin silky smooth.

children.name: salted/unsalted
children.definition: with or without salt in it
examples: Unsalted butter is better for baking.|Most butter is slightly salted.

children.name: melted butter
children.definition: heated until it is liquid
examples: Brush the pastry with a little melted butter.

children.name: a pat of butter
children.definition: a small flat piece
examples: Breakfast was a small roll and a pat of butter.

children.name: a knob of butter
children.definition: a small round piece
examples: Add a knob of butter to the meat juices in the pan.

children.name: a lump of butter
examples: He served himself a big lump of butter.

children.name: spread butter on something
examples: Lee was spreading butter on his toast.

children.name: spread something with butter
examples: Spread the warm crumpets with butter.

children.name: melt butter
examples: Melt the butter and mix it with the other ingredients.

children.name: soften butter
examples: First soften the butter in a warm place.

children.name: dairy
children.definition: used to refer to foods which are made from milk, such as cream, butter and cheese
examples: Experiment to determine your tolerance for dairy foods.
dairyproducts
low-fat dairy products

children.name: milk
children.definition: a white liquid produced by cows or goats that is drunk by people :
examples: Would you like some milk in your tea?
a type of cheese made from pasteurized milk
dried milk milk in the form of a powder which you must add water to before you can drink: sữa bột
condensed milka type of thick sweet milk sold in cans sữa đặc
evaporated milkmilk which has been made thicker and sweeter by removing some of the water from it sữa đặc
milk powderhot water mixed with milk powder

children.name: drink milk
examples: Drinking milk keeps your bones strong.

children.name: have/take milk
children.definition: drink milk in your tea or coffee
examples: Do you take milk in your coffee?

children.name: pour milk
examples: She poured some milk into a saucepan.

children.name: sour
children.definition: not fresh
examples: Milk turns sour very quickly in hot weather.

children.name: fresh
examples: She made me drink a glass of fresh milk.

children.name: cold
examples: I can only drink milk if it’s really cold.

children.name: hot/warm
examples: Can I have a cup of warm milk please?

children.name: pasteurized
children.definition: milk that has been heated to kill harmful bacteria
examples: tiệt trùng

children.name: homogenized
children.definition: milk that has had the cream mixed into the milk
examples: Most milk sold in stores is homogenized milk.

children.name: whole milk
children.definition: alsofull-fat milkUK
examples: (= milk that has not had any fat taken out )The ice cream is made from whole milk.

children.name: skimmed milkUK,skim milk/ nonfat milkUS
children.definition: milk that has had all the fat taken out
examples: sữa không kema bowl of cereal with skim milk

children.name: semi-skimmed milkUK
children.definition: alsolow-fat milk
examples: (= milk that has had some of the fat taken out )Adults should drink semi-skimmed milk rather than whole milk.

children.name: long-life milkUK
children.definition: specially treated milk that you can keep for a long time
examples: I’ve got a carton of long-life milk in the cupboard.

children.name: powdered milk
children.definition: dry milkUS
examples: Powdered milk is useful for camping trips.

children.name: baby/formula milk
children.definition: milk in powder form for babies
examples: Many babies are fed formula milk.

children.name: milk bottle
examples: Put the empty milk bottles into the crates.

children.name: milk carton
children.definition: a plastic or cardboard container in which milk is sold
examples: containers such as milk cartons and soap powder boxes

children.name: milk jug
examples: She put the butter, jam and milk jug on the table.

children.name: a glass of milk
examples: Would you like a glass of milk?

children.name: a bottle of milk
examples: I accidentally knocked over a bottle of milk.

children.name: a pint of milk
examples: I need to buy a pint of milk.

children.name: yogurt
children.definition: / yoghurta thick liquid food that tastes slightly sour and is made from milk, or an amount of this food :sữa chua
examples: a pot of strawberry yogurt
natural/ plain yogurt
low-fat yogurt
I only had a yogurt (= a container of this) for lunch.
